abstract: Tsuyoshi Kikukawa, chief executive of the Japanese manufacturer Olympus, which is embroiled in a scandal over a series of costly acquisitions, resigned on Wednesday and was succeeded by a director of the company, Hiroko Tabuchi of The New York Times reports.
